oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Academic Library Book Sales: Outreach, Community Service, and Budgetary Support
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Stothert-Maurer, Molly
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper examines the Arizona Archaeological and Historical Societyâ€™s (AAHS) biannual benefit used book sale, organized in collaboration with the Arizona State Museum (ASM) Library, as a model for community-centered fundraising in academic libraries. Amid budget constraints, the ASM Library relies on this event to support staffing and collection development. Beyond its financial impact, the sale fosters engagement among patrons, donors, and local scholars, strengthening both academic and regional connections. By integrating fundraising, collection expansion, and community outreach, the event serves as both a financial resource and a cultural initiative. This study explores its logistics, benefits, and challenges, offering insights into how academic libraries can creatively sustain their operations and enrich their communities despite financial limitations.
